thread.title: Delta, Partner GOL Sponsor 31st Brazilian Day In NYCTravelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Delta, Partner GOL Sponsor 31st Brazilian Day In NYCTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Delta, Partner GOL Sponsor 31st Brazilian Day In NYCTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Delta, Partner GOL Sponsor 31st Brazilian Day In NYC Published on : Wednesday, September 9, 2015
This Labor Day weekend, Delta continued to prove its commitment to the Brazilian market and to Brazilians living in the U.S. by once again sponsoring the Brazilian Day Festival in New York City.
The cultural festival, which celebrates Brazil’s Independence Day, attracts more than 1.5 million people from all over the country each year, spanning 25 packed city blocks in midtown Manhattan. Considered one of the largest street events in New York City, the festival is also the largest Brazilian cultural event outside of Brazil.
This year, Delta invited its Brazilian partner airline GOL Linhas Aereas Inteligentes to join it in supporting Brazilian Day, but the airline didn’t stop there. Delta also reached out to the New York Mets, successfully securing the baseball team’s sponsorship for the event as well.
“We are proud to sponsor such an important event for the Brazilian community in the U.S.,” said Hector Ruiz, regional sales manager – U.S. and Latin America. “Not only has it given us an opportunity to strengthen our ties with the community and Brazil, which is our fourth largest global market, but it has also given us a wonderful opportunity to work hand-in-hand with GOL, allowing us to continue to deepen Delta’s relationship with our strategic Brazilian partner.”
Brazil has a vibrant community living in New York City, so naturally Delta maintains a number of U.S.-Brazil routes to help community members easily visit their families; businesspeople to travel quickly; and potential tourists who would like to enjoy each country’s attractions.
Delta operates flights between four U.S. cities (Atlanta, Detroit, New York City and Orlando, starting in December) and three Brazil destinations (Brasilia, Rio de Janeiro and Sao Paulo). Furthermore, through its strategic alliance with GOL, Delta meets 99 percent of domestic demand to locations throughout Brazil – more than any other U.S. airline.
As the event’s official sponsor, Delta and GOL logos could be found all over the festival, from T-shirts to backdrops to media efforts. Delta employees from the Sales, Latin Unit Sales and Specialty Sales teams came together to host a company booth.
Source:- Delta Airlines
